revised_title: Description of a Meteor Observed in Oxford in 1766
tldr: In October 1766, a meteor was observed in Oxford. The Reverend John Swinton described the meteor as a broad luminous arch with a white and resplendent upper part and a fuscous and obscure lower part. The meteor was visible for about five minutes before it gradually faded and disappeared. This meteor was seen by other members of the University and was considered a rare and interesting phenomenon.
